name: Thistle London Heathrow Hotel

reviews.title: Awful place
reviews.text: Booked this hotel via Priceline - will definitely not bid 3* in this zone again. Long delay at check-in at 11.30pm - Reception was very understaffed and the phone was left to ring and ring. While waiting my hair and clothes were infused with cigarette smoke from people sitting in the lobby.

reviews.title: Dirty, bad service, expensive taxi
reviews.text: The corridors smell dirty and smoky too. My room was fairly clean and recently refurbished but the furniture battered and old. Towels tiny and thin and very few toiletries in the bathroom. Very cramped bathroom with cracked tiles and mould already showing through the newish grouting.

reviews.title: Double booked and offered a matress!!
reviews.text: Wish I'd stayed elsewhere and paid a bit more.
I don't know why anyone would stay here:
reviews.title: stay for the car parking

reviews.text: 1. It cost us 25 pounds to get to the hotel in a taxi from the airport (Terminal 4) - pretty much erasing any savings on the room. Importantly, it takes ~40 mins to get to the airport from the hotel if you want to take the bus to the airport shuttle.
reviews.title: Not as bad as the reviews make this out to be

reviews.text: I've stayed at the Thistle Heathrow three times in the last few years and just felt I had to comment that the bad experiences some people have experienced aren't universal. All the rooms I've stayed in have been clean and decent with AC that functioned properly. The food at the downsatirs restaurant was quite good and the breakfast buffet is excellent (though both are pricey). The food is certainly better than that at the more expensive Sheraton that's nearby. TheThistle also has a nice, large bar as well with (if you like watching planes) a good view of the runway. The rooms are well soundproofed so the aforementioned runway isn't a problem. The Thistle's staff certainly haven't bowled me over, but they've always been polite and competent. I've always had a car with me and while the parking lot is a bit sprawling and disjointed I've never had a problem finding a space and usually was able to park right out front of the lobby. The primary reason I choose the Thistle was it's location. Not only is it a conveniant airport hotel, but it's an easy walk to Hertz and some of the other car rental company lots which made picking up and dropping cars off very easy. On the downside, the lack of an elevator was a problem when I was travelling with my father who had some difficulty walking, but the next time we made sure we got a room on the ground floor. On one visit a room seemed a bit musty, but that's about it for problems. Undoubtedly there are better hotels around, but for a quick stay, especially a night before your flight I've found the Thistle to be a decent choice.
reviews.title: Not that bad
total dump !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Slum scam
reviews.text: You would have to have a screw loose to read all the reviews and still stay here. I do not even know where to start, everything was that bad. The airport shuttle even cost $. I got it on Pricline so I had to stay there. The place was a slum. Avoid or get scamed. Would not stay at this hotel if they paid me $200 a night. Its not worth it.
Coming and going to Heathrow, we had booked the Thistle for three separate nights, partly with family and baby. After night one we cancelled everything and moved across the road to the Sheraton.
reviews.title: So bad, we moved

likes.disliked: — No elevator, no parking, no service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After a ten hour flight and the usual baggage claim confusion, you can imagine we were tired. We were not in the mood to be told there was no elevator at the hotel and that we should carry our bags up those stairs or wait til a porter arrived. The room, at the end of the most dismal, long brown corridor was equally dismal.
reviews.title: very impressed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Prior to this we had driven our rental car round a confused and packed parking lot, into an overflow and off again and into another overflow where we finally found a spot and a long walk back to the main entrance.
reviews.title: Never again!!

reviews.text: I stayed here for a friend's wedding. The reception staff were nice enough, although tried to charge my other friend twice, even though he'd pre-paid. On the (long) walk to our room, we could smell damp in the corridor. We then saw the large wet patch on the ceiling above us and the soaking carpet beneath us. The ceiling was dripping heavily from a vent, right next to a light. We went to inform reception, and right up to the moment we left, nothing was done! Not even a bucket to save the carpet! I really hope no one is walking underneath that when it collapses.
reviews.title: Raining indoors

reviews.text: Wasn't too sure about their fire regulations either - we had a window that was covered by another pane of glass that you couldn't open. I did wonder what we would be expected to do in a fire.
reviews.title: Believe the reviews - this is one bad hotel

reviews.text: It was OK for the night, as I couldn't drive home after too many drinks. I wouldn't recommend it otherwise.
reviews.title: Not as bad as people say

reviews.text: I booked this through my company travel tool for a few hours' sleep during an overnight connection and with hindsight should possibly have opted for a seat in the departure lounge.
reviews.title: I had a cheap priced room online but still disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The airport shuttle for Heathrow hotels is a hidden extra - £4 each way per adult - so bear this in mind compared with Sofitel (walkable) or Park Inn (underground). If tired and you can't wait for the half-hourly shuttle, beware - a taxi from the terminal to the airport hotel costs around £20 (incredible!).
reviews.title: Unexpected stay 2
Feedback on Thistle Heathrow
reviews.text: We stayed 1 nite for price of £62incl per rm bkd on internet - you get what you pay for I guess.

reviews.title: Good start to a holiday
reviews.text: Check in staff - were young and not that great.

The rm - after reading reviews I was dreading staying here, but the rm was sufficent, bathroom is v.small indeed - and in all the hotels around the world I have ever stayed in never have we seen a sign on wall saying pls shower with door closed and steam can set the fire detectors off! How odd. The ducks dont need to be in there, very silly indeed.
reviews.title: it was great

reviews.text: Rm service - very prompt.
reviews.title: terrible

reviews.text: Car parking - do not park here, they wanted to charge guests £7 just to park the car. Better and cheaper to park on street outside the sports centre opposite.
reviews.title: Excellent value and great comfort

reviews.text: stayed for a wednesday night inbetween flights.first impression it looked very poor,really drab exterior.on entering it has a nice check in area with nice lounge area.given a 1st floor room even though my father had walking difficulties.the long corridors are really bad , disgusting carpets ,all doors are missing paint & covered with big scratches.actual room was very basic but ok just for 1 night.the duty manager got to say was great.moved us to a ground floor room ,provided a wheel chair for my father & also arranged our meals to be taken in the ground floor lounge.the actual food was ok except breakfast ,english breakfast was freezing.the only real plus side of this hotel is the staff , found them all very helpful & friendly.
reviews.title: drab exterior,handy for airport,friendly staff

reviews.text: Hotel in good location. Room clean but cold on entering. No tea and coffee making facilities in the room. Free london bus can be caught at top of the road (turn right) to terminal 5.
reviews.title: Clean hotel, but overpriced
Chasing the White Rabbit
reviews.text: Premier Inn across the road maybe cheaper though.

Business hotel, which is extremely difficult to get to from the terminals of Heathrow. Why don't they get slotted into an extension from the excellent Heathrow pod in the business car park next door? Conference rooms OK, but lunch was very ordinary indeed. Echoing corridors leave you lost and feeling as though you were chasing the White Rabbit in a downmarket production of Alice, made worse if you have a full bladder. Better signs?
reviews.title: Mouldy rooms, but close to airport and friendly staff

reviews.text: My airline bought me a room here due to a cancelled flight. The hotel is a £4.50, 10 minute bus ride from terminal 4. The only nice (or horrible) thing about the location is the proximity to the airport.
reviews.title: Happy to return to this hotel in the future

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here on Sat 1st Dec but not by choice, stayed with a Coach tour, arrived in room to find 2 single beds, 1 bath towel between us, 1 cup & only enough tea/coffee to make 1 cup. Asked a member of staff why we were in a room with 2 single beds only to be told they were full & no other rooms free, also asked him for another towel & tea/coffee and said he would be back with them but never seen again, no reply from reception when kept ringing so gave up. Went to bar that night only to be served lager in bitter glasses then at one point there was no bar staff as they had gone to get something to eat. Facilities pretty basic & rooms out of date including the TV.
reviews.title: OUTDATED & POOR SERVICE

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel was good for an overnight stay before an early morning flight. The rooms are small and need a little updating , but the evening meal was very good with a nice choice. There are plenty of car parking spaces on site , so book stay with car parking included. The bar has a very good view of flights arriving and departing, even an open air terrace when the weather is warm, a good way to while away the hours!
reviews.title: good for an overnight stay
Doesn't,t cut the mustard
reviews.text: For a 4 star hotel this place does not deliver. Rooms are small, dated and lacking in atmosphere. Bed was comfortable though. Room service was something of a joke, took 40 mins to get someone to answer the phone, and then another 40 mins to deliver the food. To add insult to injury they have the cheek to make a £5 tray charge. £100 plus per night and then they want to charge you another £10 per night to park your car ! Reception staff were indifferent and not overly competent. Restaurant staff at breakfast were very pleasant and engaging even though the cooked breakfast selection was overlooked and cold, thank goodness for cereal. Never thought I would be in a 4 star hotel looking at the Premier Inn longingly. Come on Thistle stop trading on your name and start thinking about your customers

I needed a room close to Heathrow, for a business meeting prior to a flight from Heathrow. Facilities at the Thistle are very good, and staff very attentive. Cost was considerably lower than at some other hotels in the area, and the room was more than adequate for the purpose required.
reviews.title: Good place for a business meeting

reviews.text: We were on an organised weekend break in London.The accommodation was excellent and also the evening and breakfast cuisine.
reviews.title: No negatives
Thistle London Heathrow, a huge disappointment
reviews.text: I was very disappointed in this hotel when I stayed there November 17, 2004. I have stayed in Thistle Hotels before and have found them to be exceptional, however, this one was below average. I scored it 2 stars but it only deserved 1 1/2 stars. This place is a convention center and one would think that it would be up to date. We had to drag our luggage up stairs as there is not an elevator in the place. Unbelievable!!!!!!! We then had to walk down a very long hall to another wing to find our room. Our room was small but typical of an European hotel. My bedspread had a cigarette burn in it and overall, the furnishings were quite shabby. The bathroom was small with not much free room to move about. I am glad that I was only there for overnight as I was leaving for home the next morning.
In summary, I can definitely say that if I had read the trip advisor reviews before making this booking, I would have never chosen this place.
reviews.title: Got half my money back, still wasn't worth it...
Did we get lucky?
reviews.text: Booked the hotel at Heathrow on our way through to Spain at Terminal One Hotel Booking. Stayed in Spain in all Paradore chain hotels for about $120.00 CDN ($95 USD) and loved them. Arrived at Thistle in London at about midnight. We were given a dirty room, toilet was full, soap was used and there were hairs in the bed. Asked to be moved and waited 20 mintues without hearing from anyone. Went to the front desk and asked again to be moved. Waited another twenty minutes, now it was almost 1 AM. We asked to get our money back and for the hotel to pay for a cab back to Heathrow but since we had booked through and agency they couldn't do anything. I finally just asked to be given clean sheets, and some soap. I was given a new room but the key didn't work, down to the desk AGAIN, the manager finally took us up to a new room and offered us breakfast but since we had to leave at 6 AM we wanted the extra time to sleep so he promised us a box breakfast in the morning. It never showed up. The hotel was dirty, the staff were nice but very confused and disorganized. The shuttle was overcrowded and unreliable. Would not choose to stay at Thistle again. RNM
I did not check out these reviews before we booked at this hotel for the night in late July 2004 - if I had, we wouldn't have stayed there!!
reviews.title: OK if all you need is a bed for the night
so-so hotel
reviews.text: Thankfully our experience was not as bad as some others reported here. However, the hotel is in need of a re-vamp - it's all a bit dated and tired. We paid a last minute rate of about 60 pounds, which was supposedly about 125 pounds saving off the usual rate. But I would not pay more than 60 for a room here - that's all it is worth.

reviews.title: Never Stay Here
reviews.text: I would never recommend this hotel to anyone, it was awful in every way. Check in was slow, the room was tiny, air conditioning really noisy, the whole hotel reeks of stale smoke and the worst thing about this hotel is the staff. They have no idea about customer service at all. We arrived about 10.30pm and struggled to get anything to eat, manager not interested in being helpful. Checking out was worse, there were 2 staff at reception handling check out, the queue got longer and longer due to the time taken by the staff to check people out. We asked one of the "managers" hanging about Reception if he could help out and speed things up and we were told a flat "No".....the attitude of the staff in this hotel is appalling. I will never stay here again.

We stayed at the thistle for 1 night only in june this year and got 15 days parking for 75 quid. the first room we were given was infested with ants so they moved us to another room which was very basic but as we were only there for 1 night we did'nt mind. We would'nt use this hotel again.
reviews.title: Good for parking only.

reviews.text: I wish I'd read these reviews before staying! I only paid £50, but felt ripped off! It took ages to check in, the room was very basic for "4 star" hotel, not very clean, and the bed was very uncomfortable. Combined with noisy air con and lots of noise in the hotel, this wasn't good for an early flight!
reviews.title: As bad as they say

reviews.text: The extra rip off is charging residents for parking. Whilst checking out, other customers were complaining - one didn't get his early wake up call and was rushing to catch his flight.
reviews.title: Dated Airport Hotel

reviews.text: The restaurant was ok, but very overpriced.
reviews.title: Good price via Priceline, worth your time if you paid less than $80
Never again
reviews.text: Drab, dreary and cold.
It was just for a night but unpleasant all the same.
reviews.title: Find Some Place Else To Stay

reviews.text: Bedroom was very cold and the heater blew cold air for several minutes before it got warmer.
reviews.title: There is nothing around except the Airport

reviews.text: Couldn't get a hot chocolate at the bar and walking through the restaurant to get to the bar decided to go to bed hungry.
reviews.title: A total dump of a hotel. Avoid like the plague

reviews.text: Won't be going back
reviews.title: Find Another Place To Stay!
There is nothing wrong with this hotel
reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel prior to christmas. It was ideally placed for the airport and the rooms were excellent.

reviews.title: First Class
reviews.text: Room service was reasonabe and good quality.

reviews.title: Oh dear!
reviews.text: I paid for the onsite parking for 3 weeks and had no problems at all.

reviews.title: Pretty Grim
reviews.text: The hoppa-bus to the terminals stops at the hotel and is good value for money.

reviews.title: Could have been better
reviews.text: good value for money in my opinion

description: Located close to all Heathrow terminals, and boasting spectacular views of the northern runway and architectural splendor of terminal 5, the Thistle London Heathrow is the ideal place to stay whether you are flying off early or arriving late at night. And because we’re close to central London, as well as the airport, Thistle London Heathrow is a perfect venue for business meetings and other events.
